repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Economic Management Reform
            Support Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely, with modest
            institutional development impacts. The effective Bank
            assistance in identifying the main policy issues, and in
            designing the reform program to address those issues,
            analogous with the Government's strong commitment to
            the reform program, were conducive to satisfactory
            performances, despite delays in public enterprise
            restructuring. Two key lessons suggest, first, that while
            single tranche operations, are efficient, their finance
            assistance should be tied to the budget cycle, to provide
            compensatory financing for a reform program, and
            effectiveness, if made at the beginning of the
            Government's fiscal year, so as to ease management of a
            predictable budget. Second, project financing address the
            issue of public financial management reform, which although
            central to the project, was limited by donor practices.
            These practices tie donor financing to specific projects,
            and are administered outside the budgetary system, leading
            to delays in budget performance; but, if a larger share of
            Bank assistance is channeled through the budget, along with
            an intense dialogue on the subject of public funds use, the
            budget process could substantially improve. This would
            require well prepared program budgets in all sectors, within
            a medium-term Government expenditure policy, focused on
            accountability, and auditing, under greater budgetary decentralization.

            CREDIT III
5084329.majtheme: Public sector governance,Trade and integration,Financial and private sector development

repnme.cdata!:
Burkina Faso - Economic Management Reform
            Support Operation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Management Reform Support
            Operation Project is associated with the reform program in
            Burkina Faso. The credit will have three major elements: a)
            public finance reform, to include progress towards the West
            African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU) convergence to a
            Common External Tariff (CET), as well as full integration
            into the regional customs union; b) rationalization of
            public expenditure management and strengthening of public
            administration; and c) continuation of the implementation of
            public enterprise reform. The credit is proposed as both a
            one-tranche operation, as well as the first of a series of
            such operations related to policy reforms.
